sub_title: Sustainability Consultant | Circular Economy | Data Science
summary:
I apply data science and systems thinking to develop strategies to achieve positive environmental and social change. 

My mission is to tackle global sustainability issues.

My challenge is to communicate data-driven solutions in a way that successfully influences action.

profile_positions.description: Energy & Materials Transition | Circular Economy | Life-cycle Assessment | Advanced Analytics using Python
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Metabolic is a recognised leader in using systems thinking to tackle sustainability challenges. Our overarching mission is to transition the global economy to a fundamentally sustainable and circular state. We provide strategies and tools, crunch data, create new technologies, build pilots and scale up innovations. 

I worked as a senior sustainability consultant at Metabolic and lead the companies data science team.

Clients I worked for include: Joint Research Centre (JRC), World Wildlife Fund (WWF), ABN AMRO, Rabobank, Alpro, Science-Based Targets Network, Ministry of Economic Affairs and Climate, Ministry of the Interior and Kingdom Relations,  Rijkswaterstaat, Amvest, Amsterdam Institute for Advanced Metropolitan Solutions (AMS), and several (international) municipalities and provinces. 
Additionally, I was involved in three international research projects: REPAiR, REFLOW and Plasticity. 

https://www.metabolic.nl
profile_positions.title: Data Director & Senior Sustainability Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As an interim Geodata Specialist I provided advice to the Provincie Noord-Holland and it's affiliated contractors regarding data analysis & information management.
• Data-management using Python & SQL. 
• Data visualisation using ArcGIS.
profile_positions.title: Data Specialist

profile_positions.description:
RiskChallenger is a tech-startup developed in 2016. We developed a mobile application to facilitate engagement and efficiency in the risk management process.
• Data analysis using Python.
• Data visualisation and developing interactive BI dashboards using Power BI.

https://riskchallenger.nl
profile_positions.title: Data Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Balance is a leading interim and projectmanagement consultancy firm specializing in large-scale, complex projects in the infrastructure, energy and spatial-development sector.

At Balance I was enrolled in a 2-year training program focussing on business development, project management,  risk management, communication, and effective collaboration. 

The consulting projects I worked on:
•  De Jong Zuurmond: Best Value Procurement Tender (€70 million). Co-responsible for composing the Risk Management report.
• PWN-Technologies: Contributed to advice report regarding professionalizing projectmanagement.
• Province Zuid-Holland: Contributed to quantitative scenario study for the Gouwe canal.
• Rijkswaterstaat Utrecht: Developed a verification and validation system for 'Knooppunt Hoevelaken' and a quality management guide for 'Ring Utrecht' and 'Midden Nederland'. 
• Rijkswaterstaat Haarlem: Developed product planning. 

The internal projects I contributed to:
• Developed business case proposition Circular Economy within the GWW sector.
• Developed a dashboard for integral project management using Power BI. 
• Developed and implemented a sustainable mobility plan.

Training & Workshops I developed and organised:
• Excel for Business workshop
• Power BI for Financial Management workshop
• Tutored students working on a real-life business case in collaboration with the University of Amsterdam. 

https://www.balance.nl
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As an interim Junior Risk Manager I contributed to multiple projects. My responsibilities included: 
•     Maintaining and updating risk management files.
•     Compiling progress reports.
•     Coordinating the internal and external quality insurance. 
•     Managing the configuration management and product management. 
•     Processing external audits and observations according to the System-Oriented Contract Management method.
profile_positions.title: Junior Consultant Risk Management

profile_positions.description:
In 2011 I was asked by my Professor to assist Earth Science bachelor students with the computer practicals of the Water Management course at the University of Amsterdam. Over time this developed into assisting with various geo-ecological modelling, physics and data-analysis  courses. I was responsible for assisting students during computer practicals, answering their questions on theories, modelling and programming, providing feedback and grading exams. 

The courses I taught over the periode 2011-2016 are:
• Modelling and simulation
• Programming and data analysis
• Water Management
• Climate change and sea-level rise
• Analysis of the IPCC report
• Future perspectives of the earth
• From analysis to evidence
profile_positions.title: Student Assistent - Modelling, Simulation & Programming Teacher using Matlab

profile_positions.description:
The Tesla minor is an intensive program in which a selected group of science students work on a complex challenge commissioned by a business, governmental or NGO. 

As a 'pop up' junior consultant I worked for The Port of Amsterdam. In a team of three I contributed to a complex challenge regarding sustainable development for the Port of Amsterdam. 

The Tesla Minor allowed me to apply my scientific and academic knowlegde in business and society. The minor focusses specifically on building skills regarding consultancy, project management, communication, and business development through an extensive training programme.
profile_positions.title: Port of Amsterdam - Junior Consultancy Trainee - Sustainable development

profile_positions.description:
In September 2014 I joined the Education Board that harbors the quality of the Master Earth Sciences at the University of Amsterdam. As a member of the board I was responsible to annually assess the implementation of the Teaching and Examination Regulations (OER), and issue recommendations on the new OER. My responsibilities included the following: 

 •   Advising and supporting the director of the College or Graduate School.
 •   Providing advice on study programmes and policy development within the Graduate School.
 •   Providing advice on the monitoring of study programme quality.
 •   Providing advice on the monitoring of student counseling quality.
 •   Evaluation of courses.
profile_positions.title: Vice president of the Education Board

profile_positions.description: In 2010 I was asked to become a representative of the bachelor Future Planet Studies. My responsibilities included giving presentations to inform upcoming students on the structure and learning objectives of Future Planet Studies. To do so I visited numerous highschools in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Representative of Future Planet Studies

profile_positions.description:
As a research intern in Austria I conducted research on the effects of land-cover change on shallow landslide occurrence by automated analysis of multi-temporal orthophotos through object-based image analysis.  Grade: 9,0.
Extended abstract accepted for GEOBIA conference, 2016.
profile_positions.title: Research intern on automated object-based image analysis

profile_positions.description:
From 2010 until 2012 I was part of the Dutch National Youth Counsil (Nationale Jeugdraad) on a voluntary base. During these 2 years I contributed to various projects regarding sustainable development.

http://www.njr.nl
profile_positions.title: Part of the working group ''Young & Sustainable''

profile_positions.description:
Tutored high school students (4, 5 & 6 VWO) in chemistry and physics.

https://www.studentsplus.nl
profile_positions.title: Tutor
